page.title: 02Farming in the Cuckney area.
page.content: The underlying rock is{bunter {sandstone}.There is quite a depth of sandy topsoil in which are many small rounded pebbles left by the sea millions of years ago.These enable the soil to soak up water.Mr.F.Palmer of Norton Grange Farm says that an advantage of this is that the soil can be worked soon after heavy rain,but disadvantages are that a great deal of water is needed and the soil is acid and short of lime. Because of the soil ,long rooted crops do best.Main crops grown in the area are barley,wheat,sugarbeet,potatoes, mustard seed,and oil seed rape. Lime,calcium,nitrogen,and potash are necessary fertilizers.In dry weather cannon sprinklers and self irrigation sprinklers are much used.Field sizes vary from 10 to 30 acres and are divided by fences or hedges.
